task_summary: Detect the pot and lid, approach above the pot, compute and execute a top grasp on the lid, lift it upward, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile manipulator interacts with a small pot placed on a box on a tabletop. The goal is to lift the potâ€™s lid vertically and pull back safely. The robot first perceives the pot and lid, then moves to a pregrasp above the pot. With the gripper opened, it computes a top grasp for the lid, aligns precisely, grasps, lifts along the z-axis, and retreats to clear the workspace. Timing and tolerances are conservative to avoid collisions with the pot rim and nearby fixtures.
preconditions: Lid has a graspable top feature
Robot workspace includes the pot area
stepwise_plan: Move to a safe pregrasp above the pot.
Open gripper and compute a top grasp for the lid.
Approach and align to the planned grasp.
Lift upward along z to clear the pot rim.
success_criteria: Lid is securely held in the gripper
Lid clears pot rim without collision
Robot retreats with lid stably held
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails: re-scan the area or adjust view
If alignment fails: recompute grasp pose and retry
If grasp slips: reopen, replan, and attempt a new grasp
task_long_description.termination: End when the lid is lifted clear of the pot and the arm has retreated to a safe pose.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear pregrasp alignment with gripper open near lid.
frame_3.predicts_next: Approach and final alignment before grasp.

task_instruction: lift up a lid from the pot

node_specs.description: Find the pot in the scene.
Find the lid on the pot.
Move to a safe pregrasp above the pot.
Plan a top grasp for the lid.
Approach the planned grasp and align precisely.
Close on the lid using the planned grasp.
Lift the lid vertically to clear the pot rim.
Back away to a safe distance with the lid held.

failure_modes: Lid not detected due to lighting/occlusion
Planned grasp collides with pot rim
recovery_strategy: Re-run DetectObject or ScanForTarget with different pattern
Recompute grasp with alternative strategy 'pinch' or offset_z adjustment
assumptions: Lid is detachable (not hinged) and supports a top grasp.
Pot is stable on the box and will not tip during lift.
Contact sheet frames show the arm approaching, grasping, lifting, and retreating; plan grounded to that sequence.

expected_success_criteria: No collision with pot or table
Lid raised above pot rim and robot retreats safely
